channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Low-light image enhancement based on sharpening-smoothing image filter
item.description: Finally, inverse HSV transform is applied to the enhanced V component and H, S components to obtain the enhanced image.

item.title: Mixup-Augmented Meta-Learning for Sample-Efficient Fine-Tuning of Protein Simulators
item.description: Molecular dynamics simulations have emerged as a fundamental instrument for studying biomolecules.

item.title: Biquality Learning: a Framework to Design Algorithms Dealing with Closed-Set Distribution Shifts
item.description: Training machine learning models from data with weak supervision and dataset shifts is still challenging.

item.title: Taxonomic Loss for Morphological Glossing of Low-Resource Languages
item.description: Morpheme glossing is a critical task in automated language documentation and can benefit other downstream applications greatly.

item.title: MSFlow: Multi-Scale Flow-based Framework for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection
item.description: Unsupervised anomaly detection (UAD) attracts a lot of research interest and drives widespread applications, where only anomaly-free samples are available for training.

item.title: Spatio-temporal MLP-graph network for 3D human pose estimation
item.description: Graph convolutional networks and their variants have shown significant promise in 3D human pose estimation.

item.title: AnomalyGPT: Detecting Industrial Anomalies using Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) such as MiniGPT-4 and LLaVA have demonstrated the capability of understanding images and achieved remarkable performance in various visual tasks.

item.title: Enhancing Robot Learning through Learned Human-Attention Feature Maps
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach to model and emulate the human attention with an approximate prediction model.

item.title: Vision Grid Transformer for Document Layout Analysis
item.description: Document pre-trained models and grid-based models have proven to be very effective on various tasks in Document AI.

item.title: On the Robustness of Object Detection Models in Aerial Images
item.description: The robustness of object detection models is a major concern when applied to real-world scenarios.

item.title: A Hybrid Membership Latent Distance Model for Unsigned and Signed Integer Weighted Networks
item.description: Graph representation learning (GRL) has become a prominent tool for furthering the understanding of complex networks providing tools for network embedding, link prediction, and node classification.

item.title: CLIPTrans: Transferring Visual Knowledge with Pre-trained Models for Multimodal Machine Translation
item.description: Simultaneously, there has been an influx of multilingual pre-trained models for NMT and multimodal pre-trained models for vision-language tasks, primarily in English, which have shown exceptional generalisation ability.

item.title: Learning to Upsample by Learning to Sample
item.description: We present DySample, an ultra-lightweight and effective dynamic upsampler.

item.title: Class Prior-Free Positive-Unlabeled Learning with Taylor Variational Loss for Hyperspectral Remote Sensing Imagery
item.description: Positive-unlabeled learning (PU learning) in hyperspectral remote sensing imagery (HSI) is aimed at learning a binary classifier from positive and unlabeled data, which has broad prospects in various earth vision applications.

item.title: Enhancing Mobile Face Anti-Spoofing: A Robust Framework for Diverse Attack Types under Screen Flash
item.description: In this paper, we propose an attack type robust face anti-spoofing framework under light flash, called ATR-FAS.

item.title: ADFA: Attention-augmented Differentiable top-k Feature Adaptation for Unsupervised Medical Anomaly Detection
item.description: We then apply differentiable top-k feature adaptation to train the patch descriptor, mapping the extracted feature representations to a new vector space, enabling effective detection of anomalies.

item.title: Exploring Model Transferability through the Lens of Potential Energy
item.description: The experimental results on 10 downstream tasks and 12 self-supervised models demonstrate that our approach can seamlessly integrate into existing ranking techniques and enhance their performances, revealing its effectiveness for the model selection task and its potential for understanding the mechanism in transfer learning.

item.title: Detect, Augment, Compose, and Adapt: Four Steps for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation in Object Detection
item.description: Unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) plays a crucial role in object detection when adapting a source-trained detector to a target domain without annotated data.

item.title: WSAM: Visual Explanations from Style Augmentation as Adversarial Attacker and Their Influence in Image Classification
item.description: Currently, style augmentation is capturing attention due to convolutional neural networks (CNN) being strongly biased toward recognizing textures rather than shapes.

item.title: Incorporating Neuro-Inspired Adaptability for Continual Learning in Artificial Intelligence
item.description: Continual learning aims to empower artificial intelligence (AI) with strong adaptability to the real world.

item.title: ParaGuide: Guided Diffusion Paraphrasers for Plug-and-Play Textual Style Transfer
item.description: Our parameter-efficient approach, ParaGuide, leverages paraphrase-conditioned diffusion models alongside gradient-based guidance from both off-the-shelf classifiers and strong existing style embedders to transform the style of text while preserving semantic information.

item.title: When Do Program-of-Thoughts Work for Reasoning?
item.description: Although there are effective methods like program-of-thought prompting for LLMs which uses programming language to tackle complex reasoning tasks, the specific impact of code data on the improvement of reasoning capabilities remains under-explored.

item.title: From SMOTE to Mixup for Deep Imbalanced Classification
item.description: Traditionally, the well-known synthetic minority oversampling technique (SMOTE) for data augmentation, a data mining approach for imbalanced learning, has been used to improve this generalization.

item.title: Heterogeneous Multi-Task Gaussian Cox Processes
item.description: This paper presents a novel extension of multi-task Gaussian Cox processes for modeling multiple heterogeneous correlated tasks jointly, e. g., classification and regression, via multi-output Gaussian processes (MOGP).

item.title: Improving Reinforcement Learning Training Regimes for Social Robot Navigation
item.description: We propose a method to improve the generalization performance of RL social navigation methods using curriculum learning.

item.title: Read-only Prompt Optimization for Vision-Language Few-shot Learning
item.description: RPO leverages masked attention to prevent the internal representation shift in the pre-trained model.

item.title: CEFHRI: A Communication Efficient Federated Learning Framework for Recognizing Industrial Human-Robot Interaction
item.description: Machine learning plays a vital role in industrial HRI by enhancing the adaptability and autonomy of robots in complex environments.

item.title: Reprogramming under constraints: Revisiting efficient and reliable transferability of lottery tickets
item.description: In the era of foundation models with huge pre-training budgets, the downstream tasks have been shifted to the narrative of efficient and fast adaptation.

item.title: A Comparative Study of Loss Functions: Traffic Predictions in Regular and Congestion Scenarios
item.description: While accurate forecasting of regular traffic conditions is crucial, a reliable AI system must also accurately forecast congestion scenarios to maintain safe and efficient transportation.

item.title: Ensemble of Counterfactual Explainers
item.description: In eXplainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI), several counterfactual explainers have been proposed, each focusing on some desirable properties of counterfactual instances: minimality, actionability, stability, diversity, plausibility, discriminative power.

item.title: Bayesian Integration of Information Using Top-Down Modulated WTA Networks
item.description: The results show that WTA circuits are capable of integrating the probabilistic information represented by other WTA networks, and that top down processes can improve a WTA network's inference and learning performance.

item.title: Towards quantitative precision for ECG analysis: Leveraging state space models, self-supervision and patient metadata
item.description: These components consistently enhance performance beyond the existing state-of-the-art, which is predominantly based on convolutional models.

item.title: Shared Lexical Items as Triggers of Code Switching
item.description: Why do bilingual speakers code-switch (mix their two languages)?

item.title: OEBench: Investigating Open Environment Challenges in Real-World Relational Data Streams
item.description: Moreover, while several real-world streaming datasets are available, it is uncertain whether these open environment challenges are prevalent and how existing incremental learning algorithms perform on real datasets.

item.title: CAPS: A Practical Partition Index for Filtered Similarity Search
item.description: With the surging popularity of approximate near-neighbor search (ANNS), driven by advances in neural representation learning, the ability to serve queries accompanied by a set of constraints has become an area of intense interest.

item.title: Evaluating Explanation Methods for Multivariate Time Series Classification
item.description: In many applications classification alone is not enough, we often need to classify but also understand what the model learns (e. g., why was a prediction given, based on what information in the data).

item.title: Characterizing Learning Curves During Language Model Pre-Training: Learning, Forgetting, and Stability
item.description: We quantify the final surprisal, within-run variability, age of acquisition, forgettability, and cross-run variability of learning curves for individual tokens in context.

item.title: Sub-universal variational circuits for combinatorial optimization problems
item.description: Quantum variational circuits have gained significant attention due to their applications in the quantum approximate optimization algorithm and quantum machine learning research.

item.title: Benchmarking the Generation of Fact Checking Explanations
item.description: Results show that in justification production summarization benefits from the claim information, and, in particular, that a claim-driven extractive step improves abstractive summarization performances.

item.title: Probabilistic solar flare forecasting using historical magnetogram data
item.description: In this paper, we consider over 4 solar cycles of daily historical magnetogram data from multiple instruments.

item.title: Improving Neural Ranking Models with Traditional IR Methods
item.description: Neural ranking methods based on large transformer models have recently gained significant attention in the information retrieval community, and have been adopted by major commercial solutions.

item.title: Reliability Gaps Between Groups in COMPAS Dataset
item.description: This paper investigates the inter-rater reliability of risk assessment instruments (RAIs).

item.title: Providing Previously Unseen Users Fair Recommendations Using Variational Autoencoders
item.description: An emerging definition of fairness in machine learning requires that models are oblivious to demographic user information, e. g., a user's gender or age should not influence the model.

item.title: Fast Feedforward Networks
item.description: We break the linear link between the layer size and its inference cost by introducing the fast feedforward (FFF) architecture, a logarithmic-time alternative to feedforward networks.

item.title: Efficient Discovery and Effective Evaluation of Visual Perceptual Similarity: A Benchmark and Beyond
item.description: Given an image of a certain object, the goal of VSD is to retrieve images of different objects with high perceptual visual similarity.

item.title: Spoken Language Intelligence of Large Language Models for Language Learning
item.description: Our focus is centered on evaluating the efficacy of LLMs in the realm of education, specifically in the areas of spoken language learning which encompass phonetics, phonology, and second language acquisition.

item.title: A Multi-Task Semantic Decomposition Framework with Task-specific Pre-training for Few-Shot NER
item.description: The objective of few-shot named entity recognition is to identify named entities with limited labeled instances.

item.title: Simple Modification of the Upper Confidence Bound Algorithm by Generalized Weighted Averages
item.description: In preliminary experiments, we investigated the optimal parameters of a simple generalized UCB1 (G-UCB1), prepared for comparison and GWA-UCB1, in a stochastic MAB problem with two arms.

item.title: HRGCN: Heterogeneous Graph-level Anomaly Detection with Hierarchical Relation-augmented Graph Neural Networks
item.description: To address the problem, we propose HRGCN, an unsupervised deep heterogeneous graph neural network, to model complex heterogeneous relations between different entities in the system for effectively identifying these anomalous behaviour graphs.

item.title: DISC-MedLLM: Bridging General Large Language Models and Real-World Medical Consultation
item.description: We propose DISC-MedLLM, a comprehensive solution that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to provide accurate and truthful medical response in end-to-end conversational healthcare services.
